main event: Multiple sightings of bright glowing objects in Saratoga Springs, New York, during April 1960.
interesting points: 5 ground visual observations were reported in total,The objects were described as smaller than a star with a steady bright yellow glow,The observations lasted between 3 to 10 seconds and occurred during clear weather conditions,Multiple witnesses noted the abrupt movements and steady trajectory of the objects,Due to insufficient corroborating witness data, the reports have been classified as insufficient.
witness description: civilians, with one reporting being a retired United States Navy member
